Reviews.Title: “5 Star Rating that does not live up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel983899
Reviews.Content: Shower was the worst in the world that I have ever had...no water pressure...I have stayed in at least 500 different hotels in the world, this one wins the prize as worst shower ever. Staff at the front desk were not helpful and indifferent. The restaurant next door serves breakfast, but it is VERY expensive and the food was awful. Many, many, more hotels to stay at in Montreal...this is not the one that I would chose again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique Hotel GEM Downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: kuzmonious
Reviews.Content: Great Chic Boutique Montreal hotel, service, location and rooms

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room!”
Reviews.Author: SleepingSun5634
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked a night in a Grand Lux Suite on the 6th floor. The staff were all very welcoming and the lobby area was gorgeous. The hotel is right in the heart of downtown Montreal so you're not far from major shopping and lots of restaurants. The room itself was amazing! The decor was great; modern for the most part. We loved the layout, especially the sliding doors that allowed for unrestricted view of the gorgeous bathroom. You can also opt to keep the doors shut for privacy. The bathroom....wow...the bathroom was beyond awesome. The tub was absolutely massive and there was a flatscreen tv for watching while you relax in a bubblebath. The shower is separate and very roomy. All the normal amenities were provided; bars of soap, shampoo, conditioner, bubble bath, towels, etc. There is a dimmer switch in the bathroom as well to provide a little romantic mood lighting if desired. The bed was very clean and super comfy. There was something not right about the pillows though. I'm not really sure what the deal is but they were not comfortable at all and I truly wish I brought my own with me. We didn't have any noise issues on that floor which was great. We had trouble with the thermostat, I couldn't get it to adjust at all. We checked out the pool area, which is very nicely done but didn't have our swimsuits so we didn't get to try it. I did notice that the water was warm, so while the pool isn't large enough for the kiddies to play, it's great for a relaxing soak I think. All in all, we had a stay minus the pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wendy B
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Le St. Martin hotel in Montreal. The hotel was terrific! Great value. The best part of the hotel was dealing with the concierge. Marco, Jean Sebastian, and Tom were so helpful and pleasant to deal with every single day. They made my stay outstanding. Wonderful men and they went out of their way to be friendly. Thanks so very much.

Reviews.Title: “Had to slightly revise my review”
Reviews.Author: grumpel7
Reviews.Content: I deleted and re-added my original review because I was not happy about something that happened after my stay. When we checked out, the person at the front desk asked us about our additional charges - breakfast at the restaurant and a pop from the mini fridge. We confirmed the breakfast but told her that we did not touch the fridge, and she nodded and proceeded to check us out. I thought it was all handled from here. However, a month later, my credit card statement shows a charge of $3something - for the pop is my guess. I think this is shows that there is a big flaw in their process: Do they really assume that we would pay for a meal but not admit that we had taken a pop from the mini fridge? And therefore feel justified to charge us anyways, without informing us and without checking if there might be another reason? I don't care about the $3sth that was charged to my credit card so I won't bother calling them but it has definitely soured my experience - who's to say they will not do this for other things? We have stayed many times at the St. Le-Martin in Laval and the service there is VERY different. We actually had a problem with one of the in-room movies when we stayed in February (same trip). They made the effort of informing us that their movie provider did not acknowledge a problem with the video sound and still wanted to charge, but that they would talk to them again to discuss it. But they cautioned us that a charge might appear. See the difference? My original review is below: â€œGreat location (for the winter), great room, great weekendâ€� Reviewed 21 February 2012 I tend to go to Montreal at least once a year and while in the summer I prefer to stay near Old Montreal, winter time is a different matter entirely. This time we choose to stay with the Le St-Martin Hotel since we've always had a lovely experience at the Laval one and found a great deal through SniqueAway. For anyone who wants to walk (even in the winter!) this is a great location - it's right next to the Peel metro station, steps away from the main underground shopping area (Simons, Centre Mont-Royal), a 10-min walking distance to the Fine Arts museum, Crescent Street, and Mont-Royal Park and a 20-minute walk to St Laurant & Sherbrooke. We stayed in the one of the Grand Lux rooms which was clean and comfortable. There seems to be a trend in boutique hotels these days to have a open concept - the bathroom (incl. big soaker tub) was separated from the sleeping area only by a few sliding wooden doors (blinds), so I would not recommend this room to share with friends or colleagues. Nice touches: two temperature controls (one in the bathroom, one for the sleeping area), LCD screen mounted over the bathtub (sadly, we did not have the time to try it out), turndown service, desk table that had two levels of brightness and could be turned on by touch. The fitness room was small and narrow but comfortable and did not feel too enclosed since one wall was all window (it overlooks a parking lot). Good fitness equipment although there is only one treadmill, one elliptical, one bike and one weight machine. We took a look at the outdoor pool but did not have a chance to try it out. Reception and service in the restaurant was good but not noteworthy.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad..”
Reviews.Author: starseed21
Reviews.Content: My mom, sister and I stayed here for a girls-weekend in February. Great location close to Simons and an entrance to the underground mall was right next door too! If you're into shopping this is probably a prime location to stay. The rooms were spacious and very chic. There was a window from the shower to the bedroom which was interesting. We had a good laugh at it as none of us travellers had seen this before. In my sister's words: This totally takes 'Peeping Tom' to a new level. It was funny. The beds weren't my favorite but at the same time I wouldn't complain. The decor was probably my favorite part. Who ever picked the interior I would gladly hire to do my own home haha. In the halls there were bowls with asian pear apples - such a nice touch I find. We didn't have any coffee pods in the room so we called down for them. Unfortunately for us they only brought us one. I feel that coffee is the least you can provide in a room so I wasn't overly impressed by this. Staff on the other hand could have stood to be a bit friendlier.. When asking for advice on what to do and where to go eat they didnt seem to have any hidden gems or anything great. I travel to Montreal for work so I've had the opportunity to poke around and find a few neat things that we went back to. I would have loved to make the connection and get an idea for booking my staff into this hotel but unfortunately with each person at the front this conversation was near impossible to establish. In short - I would go back as it's a beautiful property but I am sure I could find antoher place with a better level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great because of lousy attitude”
Reviews.Author: signorasempre
Reviews.Content: So first the cons. We drive up and are told we MUST give our car to the valet to park $29.a day. For Montreal uber expensive for parking. Then we walk in to lovely lobby where we are completely ignored by two people at the front desk trying to figure something out on the computer. No "bonjour", no smile no nothing.. We go to Montreal very often, most unpleasant intro to a Hotel. ever. I did complain and felt that they listened. Pros are that the Hotel is beautiful and has incredible location The rooms are lovely and spacious and clean. Wish make up lighting was better but that just seems par for the course. We did not eat at the restaurant but it was also very pretty. so we took the car away from the valet the second day and put it is a nearby lot for $16.75 a day., and we were happier. All in all not that bad but it just could have been much more pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise Alternative...Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Frequentraveler36
Reviews.Content: We were going to stay at the Sofitel Montreal but decided on the Le St-Martin. We drove from MA to VT and picked-up my daughter and son-in-law along the way to Montreal. Upon arriving at the hotel having pre-paid we were able to check in a few minutes. The valet took the car and we proceed to our rooms. Upon opening the door to the room we were very pleased with the set up of the bed and the rest of the furniture. Spacious and great color coordination. For dinner we had made reservations at a boutique restaurant but decided to eat in. We did not have reservations [highly recommended] but were seated. Having eaten at hotels before we were not sure of the service or food. MAJOR RECOMMENDATION: FOOD AND SERVICE WERE EXCELLENT [possible 3-4 stars]. One of the best meals we have had. Will make this our hotel next time we visit Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful new boutique hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Matsounet
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 3 wonderful days at Le St-Martin Hotel Particulier in Montreal. I think already the name gives it some flavor! :-) I think I might be repetitive but the rooms are very beautiful (exactly like on the pics on their website), very nice large bathroom with that big tub. Just 2 minor flaws there: the tv has been put up too high so can't watch from the tub, and the light next to the mirror is too "soft" but I agree ... minor details that maybe hotel management could pick up? Sorry, forgot to fill in the feedback form provided in the room :-) Had breakfast in their restaurant l'Aromate, very reasonable priced Continental breakfast, beautifully presented ... just like the rest of the hotel. Here also one minor flaw : the music is very loud ... especially at breakfast time?! Very friendly and helpful staff but indeed as previous reviewer wrote rather "discreet" when you passed in the lobby. Maybe it's their policy : quiet and smooth :-) The location is very good, right on the Green Metro line and within walking distance of many downtown sights. Would definitely recommend and hope to come back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable stay at the Le St-Martin”
Reviews.Author: PeteandSiobhan
Reviews.Content: We booked the Suite Verriere at the Le St-Martin Hotel for 3 nights in February through the Jetsetter website. The room exactly as the website photos - spacious, clean and comfortable, with a huge bed and full window view of the street. This didnâ€™t bother us though, the blinds were great at blocking out the morning sunlight and there wasnâ€™t too much street noise. Although on the Friday night, a nearby club did have the music pumping until the morning. There was a fireplace in the room although i think this was more for the look and not for the heat. The internal heating worked really well though. The bathroom was fantastic â€“ it had a really large tub and a TV mounted on the wall. Staff seemed quite friendly â€“ I wouldnâ€™t say they went out of their way to greet us each time we were in the foyer, however if we needed anything they were helpful. We dined in the Lâ€™Aromate restaurant on our first night, fantastic meal and lots of good choices. Weâ€™d happily recommend for others to stay at the Le St-Martin for a comfortable stay in a nice area of Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FACILITY, BUT........”
Reviews.Author: rahall
Reviews.Content: This convenient and elegantly equipped luxury hotel in a prime downtown Montreal location is lovely in most respects. I realize that this may seem like a small issue but, the fact that the windows in the suites APPEAR to open but in fact do not is a problem for someone who craves fresh air for sleeping. The heating/AC works fine but its a bit noisy and the lack of fresh air makes the rooms a little "stale". On the positive side, the suites are very well equipped and the linens and toiletries are first rate. The Bistro is brilliant and reasonably priced for a superb breakfast. The same facility in the evenings is bustling. Caution.....the bartender when we stayed was completely incapable of making a simple Martini.........AND the price for 2 was an outrageous $30 for an ill prepared and under poured (2OZ MAX) drink. Now, I realize that this is a premier location in a major city however, the bartender should know how to make a decent martini........Don't you agree?? Overall, we have enjoyed our stay and if you are OK with the lack of fresh air and avoid ordering a Martini, you will find this boutique hotel to be convenient and a lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: dore0021
Reviews.Content: My husband and I as well as another couple booked two nights in two Grand Lux suites March 2nd & 3rd. This was the nicest room I've stayed in. Then again, i haven't been in many hotels other than in hiltons/holiday inn's. Bar was stocked with drinks and snacks/treats. 2 Complimentary waters and 2 keurig coffee's. 5 minute walk from train station. 2 minute walk from Eaton Center/St-Catherines street. Only reason it's not 5 star is the cheapest breakfast is $17.95+ tax/tip. Wow. Included continental would push this to 5 stars. We went to Dunns though, 2 minutes away and had a great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: _PheobeK_
Reviews.Content: For business, I stayed at Le. St-Martin for four nights. The location was perfect, just a 3 minute walk from the office and Eaton Centre. One of the newest hotels in downtown Montreal, the room was beautiful and the hotel was clean. The only downside I had was the menu selection for dinner and breakfast, but there are so many other options in the area that it didn't affect the stay. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again and recommend to friends”
Reviews.Author: winterisfun2003
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le St-Martin Hotel for one night - the location was excellent for getting around downtown. A beautiful boutique hotel, superbly clean, friendly desk staff, and reasonable rates for such a charming hotel. Our only disappointment is that we requested a room with a fireplace and they didn't have any - however they upgraded us to a top floor room at no extra charge. We are already talking about our next trip and will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Newish hotel, good location if you want to stay in Downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: mooboy
Reviews.Content: Located on the property that used to house one of Montreal's most famous smoked meat joints (Ben's), this boutique hotel is a nice place to stay at. It is new, quiet and clean. Staff try hard but aren't at the same level as other business hotels I've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “New exciting hotel that tries very hard”
Reviews.Author: kitkatneko
Reviews.Content: It was the first time staying as this relatively new hotel, I think I have seen it under construction 2-3 years ago but I would always go other places. I finally decided to give it a try as I was staying overnight in Montreal. Very well located in the downtown of Montreal, this hotel is very convenient for every downtown related affairs. The lobby is very nice and I was nicely greeted by the staff, while pretty small - it is hard to have more than 6 people lined up at reception, the place is well decorated and rich of luxurious object. My reservation seemed to be kept in a paper file folder. I make a deposit to secure the room using the credit card roll over type of machine, I did not know they made those anymore. despite the old tech, should I say non-tech paper procedure, all is good and staff is very courteous and welcoming. After checking-in I enter in a nice looking elevator, modern, floor access locked by card, I notice the washroom-like sent in the air and looking up I see the lavatory-style air freshener device. It looks very nice and feels modern but it smells like washrooms. Room access is card tap-activated and the room is filled by luxury and all looks very good and new. Very clean. There is not a lot of room around the bed but the room feels good. It has a modern, luxurious look everyone expect. Flat TV, ipod radio clock, power surge protected outlet on the desk. And the bathroom, very well decorated, extra clean and spacious feel. It may surprise a few but the shower has a view on the room. While in most of the other hotel the bathroom is secluded by walls to the rest of the room, here it is embedded and one can view the room from the bathroom and likewise. I might become handy but you would need to know this if going with someone else. At night I found the place very noisy, it was not the elevators but constant ventilation or neighbors door shutting was annoying. Overwall, all is well decorated, luxurious feel everywhere, great staff but somewhat feel not up to date due to paper based processes (checkin/out) and really they should change the sent they have in the elevators...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay for the weekend”
Reviews.Author: Matt B
Reviews.Content: I think it's important to add a few background details to give you some perspective from which to read this review. My wife and I are young couple (early 20s) who were staying at Le St-Martin for a weekend getaway for Valentine's Day. We stayed from a Friday night thru Sunday morning. I'll now break down the individual ratings I gave with what I hope to be helpful information in each category. Service: We arrived shortly after 9:00pm entered the lobby. After providing check-in information a bellhop retrieved our bags and escorted us to our room. I turned over the car-keys and he provided me with a valet ticket. So, the entire check-in/valet process may have taken all of 4 minutes- rather impressive, but again, it was 5 hours after typical check-in. During our stay, our room was only serviced once, but that was largely on us, as we spent the better part of the day Saturday just hanging out in the room. Back to the valet service- upon leaving for dinner on Saturday night and checking out Sunday morning, our car was retrieved in a speedy 2 minutes each time. Another thing- I'm not positive, but I suspect that the parking lot to the rear of the hotel is not the lot used for the valet. The reason I say this is because throughout the entire weekend, the temp never went above 20*F, but when the car was retrieved, the door handles, steering wheel and seats were all warm as if the car was being kept out of the elements in a covered garage somewhere. Value: Value was excellent, but I'll tell you why. I was able to book the Verriere (Superior) Suite for $180/night due to the last-minute nature of our trip. Booking this room through the property itself will run you $245/night on the same weekend. So then, the reason I only gave a "Very Good" rating for value was because a huge part of that was the savings I received through the travel site. Mini-bar was typical- $3 for a Coke, $6 for a beer, $7.50 for a nip of liquor. The valet service will run you $23 per night+tax+tips, which, unless you use it at least twice a day, seems a little steep to me, especially since you really don't have any other options for car-parking. Sleep Quality: I slept fantastically on the King-sized bed we had. Definitely not a cheap-hotel bed either, probably a Simmons or something. We had four pillows between the two of us, with two additional HUGE throw pillows and a nice down comforter. I've seen other reviewers have issues with street noise but we were on the 3rd floor and I didn't think it was that bad in the later hours. Keep in mind though, it was February and freezing cold out for our entire stay. Cleanliness: The room was spotless upon arrival and when cleaned on Saturday morning spotless again. I'll group re-supply into this category as well since the maids are responsible for that. The mini-bar wasn't restocked, which, for us wasn't really an issue but if you're the type of traveler who relies on it, take this into account. Either way, it comes fully loaded with 8 cans of soda, 3 beers, 8 nips of liquor, 3 bottles of wine 2 bottles of juice, a red bull and a bunch of chips and nuts and stuff so bleeding it dry would be a challenge. Location: This hotel is in what I consider to be a prime location. There's plenty of restaurants and shopping within short walking distance, even when it's only 10*F outside. For food, there's a Subway right across the street if you're looking for fast-food breakfast or lunch, and a couple Canadian chain joints 1 block to the southeast. The hotel is in Downtown so fine-dining is readily available as well, in pretty much every direction. Shopping is also very abundant in Downtown so if that's what you're in to, have at it. One cool tip I have for you is that if you head down Rue Metcalfe (down the hill to the right of the hotel entrance) you'll see a store called Simons on your left. Once you're in Simons, look around for an escalator that goes down a level. Take it down and you'll be in a massive underground network of shops and stores that stretches for around 4 blocks along Rue St. Catherine. As for the types of stores, think Levis and Old Navy rather than Louis Vuitton or Gucci. At the eastern most end, you have a positively enormous department store called Ailes. Best of all, it was warm underground. Rooms: I can really only speak for the Verriere Suite in terms of design and amenities, and this room has it all. The panoramic windows are an absolutely fantastic touch which make it hard to get out of bed in the morning. I should note though that the windows are adorned by Roman shades so they open and close but can not be put up or down. Even still, the view was very nice. Television is large, swivels, and has 25 channels (roughly 15 English/10 French). The bathroom has a VERY large soaking tub (no jets), another television(very cool) and a good-sized glass shower. Toiletries weren't name brand, but were still high-quality, including a "glycerin soap bar" which was a new and very enjoyable experience for me. The room came equipped with a Keurig machine which my wife thought was a fantastic amenity, although like the mini-bar items, the k-cups were never restocked so I would caution you to bring your own. Moving back into the bedroom, I want to be very clear about one amenity in this room- the fireplace. This was a huge draw for me when booking the room, but in reality, it's a little lackluster. For some reason, I was thinking it was a gas fireplace (in retrospect that would be a ridiculous liability for the hotel to assume), but it's actually an electric one that does not produce any heat. At any rate, it's not a tacky model and is a nice touch with the lights off and a view of the city. All in all, I can highly recommend this hotel based on location alone. Now, if the Verriere Suite is avaialable for less than $200/night, I would say it's an absolute no-brainer, and you will not be disappointed with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room! Horrible Staff ! Danger Will Robinson”
Reviews.Author: donojames
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here over New Years Eve..I cannot honestly rememeber an experience at a 4 star hotel with such an indifferent staff. So to begin. We pulled up in the taxi during a snow storm and unloaded our suitcases while the bellman stood at the door and watched us unload and drag the suitcases in We werent greeted at the front desk and they seemed to have trouble finding a reservation No assistance to carry luggage to the rooms We asked the "concierge" to help us book a place for dinner New Years Eve..he seemed baffled, and told us he doubted anything was available, He finally came up with a place he found in a brochure lying on the counter and dinner was at six. WE went up stairs and used Open table and found a reservation for one of the 10 best restaurants in Quebec in 5 minutes. He is a concierge for gods sake..try the internet!! WE did have an amazing dinner no thanks to our buddy at the desk and ended up not asking for any suggestions during our stay because it was clear they didnt have a clue. The service in the bar was odd with the staff spending a lot of time talking to each other and ignoring customers The final straw was on New Years Day. The hotel Restaurant was closed..the same hotel that advertised special new years packages and when we asked for a dinner suggestion we were told.." it was going to be tough as most restaurants were closed and the really didnt know of anything..maybe the burger place across the street" Okay you are a 5 star hotel and your own restaurant is closed on New Years Day..do you think you might have gotten on line and pulled a list of restaurants that were open for your guests? Not Here...so again I used Urban Spoon and Open table and found about 20 places open and ready for diners. I showed the Urban Spoon application to the guy at the Bell Stand..his response "cool" There are great Hotels in montreal...this isnt one of them The rooms are beautiful and the physical facility is really nice..best case..early bankruptcy and a new management team comes in who can actually run a 4 ot 5 star hotel..until then Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, close to lots of things”
Reviews.Author: catlaw98
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend in Montreal over the summer. Wonderful city! The hotel was very nice. Room was modern and stylish. The staff was very helpful. Close to St. Catherine and the old part of the city. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Montreal weekend.”
Reviews.Author: 3d3mon3
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend in Montreal, the staff was very polite and helpful, the rooms were nice, comfortable and clean. The outdoor heated pool was very warm to accomodate the -22 degrees outside, And the location of the hotel was perfect. I Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel in the heart of Montreal”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyM_Canada
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern, trendy & stylish are how i would describe this property in downtown Montreal. The rooms are spacious and comfortable with a good selection of ammeneties. There was a deep soaker tub in the large bathroom which we made use of. The lobby is quite simple but the restaurant and staff are top-notch. If you're looking for a conveniently located hotel, this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the heart of downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Vacationer0052
Reviews.Content: This is a jewel of a hotel in downtown Montreal. It is modern, chic and comfortable. The rooms are up-to-date in every way, elegantly furnished and comfortable. The food is deliciious and the atmosphere is European chic without being pretentious. Excellent service from friendly staff. It is priced a bit higher than some chain hotel alternatives in the area, but well worth the expense. A real pleasure - we will return!

Reviews.Title: “No hot water, no upgrade, no refund!”
Reviews.Author: ramblingal57415
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazingly clean and new with a fabulous outdoor pool. The staff was less than accommodating especially when we realized there was no hot water in the room. In fact the whole hotel had no hot water for the whole night and there was no apology, no upgrade and no refund. When we checked out all we could get was free parking for the whole ordeal. I had chlorine all over me from swimming in the pool and went out without taking a shower, kind of a big deal. Needless to stay I will not be staying here again because of the staff, but would have recommended the hotel had they given us a free future stay, an upgrade or a refund, or even an apology!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the center of it al”
Reviews.Author: traveler3665
Reviews.Content: New hotel in the middle of downtown, close to everything. Very helpful staff, very nice rooms and a good deal for Montreal! Close to underground, st Catherine shopping and McGill university. A short cab ride to old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Montreal”
Reviews.Author: mkjr
Reviews.Content: The location is great for this hotel. It is also new and very clean. Some have complained about the more open concept for the bathroom but in my view, those reviews are way overated. Valet parking is expensive but I could not find many other cheaper options that allowed overnight parking. Great service for Montreal. For the price of US$150 per night (parking was extra), it was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel - will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Uffizi777
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on tripadvisor and delighted that we did! My husband and I travelled to Montreal for a weekend of shopping and relaxing. We stayed for 3 nights. We usually stay at boutique hotels in Old Montreal but wanted to be closer to Ste. Catherine Street for some Christmas shopping. We were not disappointed in this hotel. We arrived early in the morning and our room - a Grand Luxe suite - was actually ready. The hotel is just over a year old...new...clean...very pleasant decor. Staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was awesome...comfortable bed...lovely linens...the bathroom was gorgeous with sliding shutter doors separating it from the bedroom...we were not at all bothered by this and actually thought it was a romantic touch...obviously this room is more suited for couples!! There are flat screen TVs in the bedroom and the bathroom. There is a room safe and a mini-bar fridge. Our suite had a corner fireplace (not real but still very nice) and a Keruig coffee maker. Bottled water and wifi were free. We were in room 401 which was on a corner...we heard no street noise at night. We did not eat at the restaurant downstairs but did stop into the bar twice on our way back to our room at night. It was busy, noisy and fun and just what we were looking for! The location of this hotel is perfect...a 5 minute walk from the main shopping area and right next door to a Metro station...we will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: alyssa s
Reviews.Content: Was very impressed by this hotel. Loved the bathroom and especially the seperation between bedroom and bathroom...very romantic. Front desk staff was great, and very accomodating with my early check in and answered all my questions about where to eat, visit, and shop. The location is amazing, walking distance from shops and restaurants. I would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel nice; restaurant needs to grow up”
Reviews.Author: idletgoifihadagrip
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a belated birthday celebration in Montreal. Stayed two nights at the St-Martin. Room was lovely, having reserved the Classic King Foyer. Plenty of room, fireplace, clean. We were able to check into our room around noon which was helpful to get an early start to our day. Referrals for restaurants were excellent from the staff. We had a lovely breakfast Saturday morning but when we returned to the hotel after watching a game at the Bell Centre, we decided to stop for a drink in the restaurant, L'Aromate. We sat at the bar and ordered a drink. No music was playing until we sat down and then it was blaring. Others at the bar asked for the music to be lowered. The bartender agreed but within five minutes, some young man danced his way behind the bar to increase the volume and change the music (it was connected to the stereo on his iphone). This happened several times before my husband again asked for the volume to be lowered. There was no way we could have a conversation under those conditions. I don't mind loud music but if that's what I had wanted, we would have gone to a dance bar. This was a restaurant. Between this young man constantly changing songs, raising the level of music and glasses of champagne being smashed on the floor across from us, we stayed long enough to finish our drink. At least three other tables left around the same time. What seemed to be some sort of celebration in the restaurant took over the place, with servers drinking and dancing and completely ignoring the idea that this was a public restaurant with other patrons. In what seemed like a classy place, it quickly dropped to amateurish and rude. We complained to the bartender who basically threw up his hands in embarrassment. We complained to the front desk, who said it wasn't the first time they've received complaints about the restaurant. They did offer us coupons for a limited breakfast there the next day. My advice: avoid this place or just don't ever expect consistent, good service. It was a real disappointment in what was otherwise a nice trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, suite, staff clean, location!......had it all.”
Reviews.Author: HollyRadar
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was wonderful, the suite was beautiful clean roomy the view great, bahroom shower roomy and squeeky clean, The only problem the ceiling to floor wall to wall windows are only covered by light blinds, so if you are like us and like a dark room to sleep in then that could be a problem. My Husband is in the hotel drapery business and said it would be an easy fix for them to add a blackout drape in front of the blinds.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, shame about the windows”
Reviews.Author: mr.weinerdog
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in October; what a fantastic hotel in terms of design and service. The rooms are beautiful- more design oriented than a generic business hotel like a Sofitel, but more practical than the dim-lighting trendy style like W-Hotels- a perfect combination of design and practicality. We had a corner room with fireplace (decorative only) with a large soaker tub. The pictures on the hotel website are very accurate. Service was also top-notch. Nice extras like free bottled water and wi-fi, a free beverage and snack service in the evening- nice touch. But then there are the windows....I don't know if someone cut corners in construction (the Hotel is just over a year old) or what, but when we went to bed- so the room was quiet- you could hear EVERYTHING that was happening outside. It was as if the window was open- which it wasn't- they don't open! I have stayed in other Montreal hotels are equally busy streets- actually more busy streets- but never heard street noise in the room like this before- and we were on the 8th floor. I actually went to the window and you could feel air- and hear sound- streaming in along the bottom of the window. The cavity below the window also seemed hollow. This is also a walking route from the McGill student area to the downtown bars, so the street noise (esp. Fri & Sat) consists of frequent groups of screaming students from 11:00 PM to 4:00 AM, mixed in with sirens. Then the beeping of the delivery trucks start at 6 AM. Heck we could even hear dogs barking and people talking- from the sidewalk 8 stories below. 'm not sure, but something is definitely not right. Perhaps some spray foam and caulking could help? The only other disappointment was the exercise room- so small. The Crystal has them beat here (similar style, similar price). So while the service and condition of the room were far superior to the Crystal, and more stylish than the Sofitel, the windows are a deal-breaker- as much as I would like to return.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Earl R
Reviews.Content: The room was very well furnished and comfortable, the complimentary breakfast was excellent and appreciated the free wi fi.

Reviews.Title: “realtively new boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: loppy
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights. Staff friendly. did not use the restaurants. Each day I left early and came in late. Bed was very comfortable. Bathroom is large with separate shower. Musty smell in bathroom that needs attention. Alerted staff only on check out. Location is great as it is close to all underground shopping, metro stations and Universities.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderfull stay”
Reviews.Author: Ren819
Reviews.Content: We arrived at le St-Martin, on October 23rd, 2011. My first impression of this hotel was "Wow, what a great Loby" there's a big fireplace and a very interesting huge piece of glass art work that looks beautifull over the check-in counter. We cheked-in without a fuss, and we actually had booked our room with a discounted rate on expedia wich was nice, we had opted for the Grand Lux Suite with fireplace. The room was gorgeous, great bathroom, shower and tup we're clean and impeccable. The bed was extra comfortable, and the fireplace realy added a little romantic touch. The design of the room is more colonial that modern, but still and overall nice decorating style. We had a problem with our television and notified the staff when we left for a bite to eat and shop and when we returned it was fixed :) Staff was quick and efficient. One of the best features of this hotel realy has to be the location. One block up from st-Catherine's street (right near Simons), its perfectly situated if you're planning on shopping, or going the the Bell center (we we're in Montreal for a Canadians game) I will definetly be going back to Le St-Martin, nous avons adorÃ© notre sÃ©jour !

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: JulyJKJ
Reviews.Content: I always do lots of research before booking a hotel. This one had some of the best reviews so I thought I would give it a try. Good start when on the way from the airport the cab driver when he found out where I was staying commented that this was a "very, very nice hotel-great location you will really enjoy it." It was the best location five minute walk and you are right at the center of rue St. Catherine. I walked for hours (and shopped) and returned to the hotel twice during the day to return packages and take a little break. I emailed before arriving and asked for an early check in since my flight got me to Montreal at 10:00 am. Just before I landed I received an email saying my room was waiting for me to check in-that doesn't often happen. So when I got there five minutes check in and done. When the cab pulled up to the hotel the doorman in his brass buttoned coat opened the cab door and took my bags into the hotel to the front desk as if I was a VIP. Good first impression, big potted palms outside the entrance beautiful lobby with fireplace and tall ceilings. This reminds you of a really chic boutique hotel in New York. Stayed on the 12th floor in a two queen room. It was beautiful, bathroom was very elegant and everything was brand new and very clean. Beautiful bedding and decor and I actually slept great in their bed. Overall this was a really nice treat. I was there for three days, two nights for a meeting and this made it feel like a little luxury getaway. Can't wait to stay there again. BTW the rate I got was online and I thought it was an excellent deal at 180.00.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Updated”
Reviews.Author: hurricayne
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel as we found a good deal on the jetsetter website. We were pleasantly greeted by the hotel staff. When we walked up to our room and found that it was still being cleaned, the hotel felt bad and actually upgraded us. We were very happy with the room. Clean, modern, updated and most importantly quiet! We also had a chance to take advantage of the heated pool with the complimentary pool towels. The place is also walking distance to many sites which we also liked. Definitely would come back to this hotel again the next time I'm in Montreal!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Hellloooo Luxury!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alegra H
Reviews.Content: stayed here this past weekend with my husband. was really really nervous about picking a hotel in Montreal since all of them are really old. I was SOOO happy I chose the St. Martin. The rooms are just beautiful, beds were really comfortable and it was really really clean. The bathroom was my favorite! The tub was perfect for 2, and the tv facing it was great! At around 7 pm one of the staff knocked on the door and offered coffee,tea,fruit and some snacks all COMPLIMENTARY. All staff were REALLY REALLY nice, I got the AAA rate which included the parking rate, Valet staff were so nice and amazing. My brother was actually staying at another hotel and switched to ours because it was just WONDERFUL. Dont forget the LOCATION which was GREAT! literally a minute away from shopping and great restaurants! I HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A first rate experience...”
Reviews.Author: Teresa F
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Le St-Martin Hotel for 2 1/2 weeks and was treated like a pampered guest. The room was very comfortable (excellent mattress and pillows!), the restaurant was also excellent. While dinner was a delicious experience, it was their daily breakfast (loved the fruit minestrone) and capuccino that really got my day started. Everyone that works there is friendly and helpful. I have a lot of business in Montreal over the next several months, and I plan to stay at Le St-Martin every time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Montcalm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and all around it was a great experience... Staff - from reservations to check-in and everything in between - the interaction with staff was excellent. Room: I had a corner room which was very large, had a faux fireplace, floor to ceiling windows, fabulous well equipped and stocked bathroom and one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've slept in in a while! The room was exceptionally clean. Rooms are also very quiet. Location- fabulous for seeing Montreal, business meetings and choice of restaurants. Cabs are at hand across the street and they have valet parking. Security is very good at hotel -access to floors is limited to your floor only - don't take the stairs, you'll have to go all the way down to get out. What is most telling is that I was there with a group and not one person had a complaint to speak of ... except that maybe bar prices are a bit high. Apparently restaurant is well rated - but we didn't eat in as there is so much choice in walking distance. I would stay here again ... and not only for business!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: skiadct
Reviews.Content: Rooms were immaculate with beautiful furnishings and bathrooms, comfy bedding and nice views. Staff were great and very accommodating. small but very relaxing and stylish pool area. Overall would stay here again. Excellent location downtown. Very chic and modern hotel. Never heard hallway noise and doors seem very thick but we we awoken one night by very loud "adult acrobatics" next door. They were probably excessively loud and less the fault of the build quality of the hotel but it was very disturbing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location... service, not so much”
Reviews.Author: marctor
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nice, a little overdone but comfortable. Location is the best of all hotels I've stayed in Montreal and that alone is a good reason to return. As a previous reviewer has pointed out, front desk was not the most pleasant to deal with - just indifferent and lacking proper training. Bell captains were excellent though. Overall it was a nice experience and I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at great price”
Reviews.Author: FlyingFig514
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the perfect location of this little gem. Could not have been more convenient to McGill and great shopping. Loved the free water bottles and fruit on each floor. Perfect Asian pears, delicious. Restaurant provided a delicious and generous continental breakfast. It's the little extras that make your day, like the complimentary soft drink/juice/chocolate fortune cookies that came by late afternoon..... The bathroom was spacious and while some commented on the lack of privacy, as a solo traveler it was decadent and much enjoyed. A minor inconvenience was the elevator security system which only allows access to your floor, so if you know someone on a different floor, you can't go to their room. And don't try the stairs as you will be locked out and be able to exit the stairwell at the ground floor! We did get a great rate for this visit, but would actually pay more to stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “I thought that this hotel was very nice. Clean and friendly staff. I would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Berly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and it was perfect. It is a great location for shopping and nightlife. The fares are a bit high when you book directly, but we were able to find discounted rates on a few travel sites without issue. I would recommed this hotel and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Mark D
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right downtown near everything I needed to get to. It was an easy 10 minute walk north of the train station. It is also sits right beside a metro (subway) station for easy access to much of the city. Lots of restaurants, bars, and shopping within walking distance. The hotel is very new and clean. The room, while somewhat small, was very nice and had some unique touches which made it stand out from many standard hotel rooms. The bed was very comfortable and the service was great. The hotel was very quiet and relaxing. Like most hotels the in-room snacks and beverages were expensive, as is the room service. Wi-Fi was free for 24-hours once initiated, which was all I needed. I did not enquire about service beyond the 24-hour limit. I was travelling alone on this trip but I think it would be a great choice for couples and business travellers. My impression was that it may be less suited for family vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location...”
Reviews.Author: Coco3000
Reviews.Content: Exquisite new Hotel in perfect location,close to shops & restaurants!Friendly personnel,always ready to assist you.Rooms are nicely decorated & the beds very confy.Very pleasant experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a great location”
Reviews.Author: advisortopnotch
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le St-Martin hotel for the first time and I had a great stay, staff very friendly and accommodating, check in was quick and the receptionist was able to provide me with all hotel amenitties and services information while she was processing my registration. I was explained how the key and elevators work as well as the inclusions in the room in a friendly and warm way Upon my departure, staff asked about my stay and I confirmed was very good, i was handed out my bill and it was accurate The room itself is big, modern equipment and amenities in place, well decorated and inviting, even though the hotle is located at a busy intersection the room is well insulated and quiet, which made it perfect for a good night sleep Location is great, central and close to many local attractions, shopping and restaurants, make it easy to simply walk around and enjoy what Montreal has to offer Overall, great hotel, friendly staff, excellent value, ample and comfortable rooms with modern ammenities

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: 1whereintheworldami1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here briefly, while working in Montreal. Our entire team checked at midnight with almost 40 bags during a rainstorm. The bell captain took care us so that we could get out of the rain and get our principal staff directly to there rooms. Although there had been some confusion the reservation via our travel agent the manger on duty quickly got us rooms. The rooms are clean and spacious with updated amenities. The design is a bit colonial for my taste but consistent with the general aesthetic of the neighborhood. I wish the bar was open later, but there were many to choose from just out the door.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and professional staff”
Reviews.Author: marcelfro
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Le St-Martin in October 2011,my first stay at this fine facility,but unlikely my last. The room assigned was on the 16th floor,very well decorated with modern and very comfortable furnishings.The service throughout was friendly and professional from the reception to the parking attendant and door men.Had breakfast in the Hotel restaurant which was excellent. I highly recommend this facility situated in the heart of downtown Montreal Marcel Lacoste OtterBurn Park QC

Reviews.Title: “Awesome weekend @ Le St. Martin”
Reviews.Author: CitySnob0820
Reviews.Content: Spent two days at Le St Martin and was very impressed. The whole place feels very clean and brand new, from the perfectly crisp, white bed linens to the spotless carpet. Not a trace of dust on any surface nor the smell of old furnishings that you find in larger outfits. Wonderful location right in the center of the downtown area, near McGill. Everything worth seeing seems to be within walking distance. It really was the perfect blend of boutique charm and the comfort of an upscale chain. Bathroom was roomy with double-vanity (marble counter!) and complete with Keurig cup coffeemaker-- nice touch. My only complaints would be that the bathrobes are somewhat rough, and the restaurant is way overpriced (we skipped it altogether, since Montreal is filled with more reasonable and diverse options). I also found it odd that the blackout curtains didn't extend across the length of our window, leaving a large gap in the center covered only with a sheer white drape. However, the light coming in didn't disrupt our sleep in the morning, so it worked out just fine. All in all, I highly recommend this hotel to travelers of all kinds-- couples or friends, old or young. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: J H
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located in Downtown Montreal. There are lots of great restaurants and shopping within walking distance.The hotel is just over a year old and it is very clean. The decor is superb. The security is above average (elevator: must have a passkey to operate, room safe is in bathroom.) Got a suite and it was a fantastic room. Huge soaker tub for two, great view (windows on three sides!), comfy bed and clean linens. Mini bar is stocked with quality goods. Room service was quick and friendly (breakfast). The outdoor pool is heated and while on the small side, it was very nice to soak in. Service at the front desk was friendly and efficient. I would recommend this hotel for its cleanliness and friendly service. The only con to our experience was the late night noise from the street below. It was a Saturday night that we stayed at the hotel and we had a lot of glass area in our suite. This situation is not under the control of the hotel. If you have young children, you may want to request a room with fewer windows or less window area. Overall GO TO THIS HOTEL: great value and very clean!! Also a non smoking hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 2Calgarians
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, beautiful room and a wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Car_guy3
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, beautiful lobby. Very good restaurant. Hosted a corporate event here and I enjoyed it very much. All services worked well including wifi and the staff were very helpful and eagar to make sure we had a great experience. I highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located downtown with a great view”
Reviews.Author: P L
Reviews.Content: When travelling I enjoying going off the beaten path of staying in major chains, so when the opportunity came up to try out this boutique hotel in Montreal it was an easy decision. Arriving late on the Friday evening the valet was prompt to help with the luggage and check-in was quick and friendly. The Verriere suite which was part of the stay package wass spacious and the seperate soaker tub was an added bonus for my friend who I was travelling with. Breakfast service in the morning was quick and the food was good (especially the bacon!) and so were the drinks in the bar in the evening. The two small details I would have to point out was the noise from the street at night and the noise coming from another room of a couple engaging in some late night activities. The walls are a bit thin but is like that in many hotels. Other than the noise the stay itself was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “great location and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: vacationh0lic
Reviews.Content: My favorite thing about this hotel is its location. It's about a block away from the nearest metro stop (Peel), although you probably don't need to take the subway to get to most attractions if you don't mind a bit of walking. It's about 5 blocks away from one of the main entrances into Parc du Mont Royal (at Rue Peel and Avenue des Pins Ouest), and it's a must visit on a nice day! Oh heck, that's not my only favorite thing about the hotel. I love their daily complimentary coffee brewer and bottled water refills - two things I need daily, their super firm yet fluffy pillows, and their workstation with desk top outlet (so you don't have to crawl under to plug/unplug). Standard room comes with a sizable shower stall, no bathtub, in case you're into that stuff... I could care less. Some previous reviews complained about the wifi. Let me just affirm that I haven't had any wifi connectivity issues during my entire stay here, and I used it daily. Wifi is consistent and relatively fast (although I didn't do any heavy downloading). It resets every 24hrs so you just need to reenter your room info to restart the cycle. The gym is on the 4th floor right by my room, which I never used. I took a peek and thought it was pretty small, but I really didn't have the need to run like a hamster on my vacay when I'm walking everywhere. The room service from the restaurant downstairs (L'Aromate) is prompt (but pricey as expected)! It took them 10-15min to deliver my food, and they were pretty tasty. The room cleaning service starts early. They'd be guaranteed to knock on my door by 9am if I didn't have a "do not disturb" sign out. So make sure you have it out if you plan on sleeping in one morning. Or else 3 knocks and they're in.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel!”
Reviews.Author: benw78
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Grand Lux room and it was stunning. The room was very clean and spacious. The service was great but could be even be a bit more friendlier, valet service was prompt and courteous. The included breakfast was also delicious and much better than your average continental breakfast. I've never stayed at a hotel and left thinking "wow, everything was just perfect". We also had a celebrity stay at the hotel the same weekend we were there. The location of the hotel is perfect and right in the downtown core.

Reviews.Title: “Room w/fireplace was beautiful, staff wasn't the friendliest”
Reviews.Author: travelbug2376
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a boutique hotel right near the metro and just a block off the main shopping area of Rue St. Catherine, so the location was great. The room was absolutely beautiful with a very large bathroom with seperate tub and shower, a double sink, and a sliding door which you could leave open or closed and see into the bedroom. It was immaculate and inexpensive in comparison to other rooms we priced of similar quality. The outdoor whirlpool style pool was small, but very well maintained and a great addition to the hotel. The hotel also has a trendy French restaurant on the premises, which seemed busy every night, though we did not eat there so I can't vouch for the food. The valet parking fee was in line with other hotels and did offer in/out privilages which was a bonus. The valet/bell captains were very nice and friendly enough. The concierge/main desk staff lacked the social skills one would expect from the welcome desk in a touristy city. You didn't get that welcome feeling when you arrived nor throughout the stay. They weren't especially rude, just sort of indifferent. However, despite the coldness of the front desk staff, I would not let this sway you from staying here. Clean, beautiful, sexy hotel for a reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Brand new and excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: mvanimpe
Reviews.Content: Le St-Martin is new hotel in the city center of Montreal. Shopping and dining is only steps away. The historic centre of Montreal is a short walk. The hotel has a nice contemporary style. The rooms are very beautiful, they can compete with many of the 5 star hotels we have stayed before. The little outdoor swimming pool is really nice during a hot summer night. The restaurant of the hotel serves sophisticated meals with a European flavor. However, it is not cheap. Luckily there are many budget friendly options in the neighborhood. Le St-Martin is warmly recommended by us.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: johnny010101
Reviews.Content: Our daughter gave us a wedding anniversary stay at the hotel. It was fabulous! Our room was spacious and luxurious. Hotel has very friendly staff and great room service. . The only hotel we recommend to stay in downtown Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “"Wonderful hotel in every way!"”
Reviews.Author: Steve K
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, luxurious room; friendly helpful staff; hotel is centrally and very conveniently located! Could get everywhere (almost) on nearby metro which is very clean, safe though non air-conditioned. Buy multi trip pass.

Reviews.Title: “â€œFamily of 7 (3 rooms) - ages 7, 18, 19, 25, 27, 50 & 76 years all loved it !!â€�”
Reviews.Author: JPTA2011
Reviews.Content: I must admit that I was slightly worried about some of the reviews I'd read on here; but needn't have been, this little hotel is super. We arrived 2 hours early for check in - the valet parking worked like a dream. The reception staff were extremely polite and facilitated a quick and easy check-in. We didn't have to wait for our rooms they were ready for us and were all delighted with them, lovely comfortable beds, bathrooms and very clean. The staff were super throughout; the continental breakfast was delicious and the lady waitress even remembered our preferences on the 2nd day. We loved sitting around the pool and although it is small, it served our purposes and the youngest member of our group in particular loved it in there. The concierge seemed extremely knowledgeable about restaurants and pointed us in the direction of a superb place for dinner that exactly met our needs. In fact we went back there the next day for lunch we because we enjoyed it so much. Despite the hotel being sold out of King rooms on the night of our departure the hotel accommodated a late check out until 2 pm for us all, of course, per many hotels we had to re validate our keys at 11am so that they worked until 2pm but the reception staff advised us. The hotel is in a super location, great security ... city centre close to great stores and a 5 minute taxi ride (approx Canadian $8 inc tip) from the Basilica Notre Dame and old Montreal. IF I was forced to give any constructive feedback it would be to the staff in the hotel bistro bar. Not outstanding; and we probably wouldn't use this facility in the hotel again. However, saying that we did notice that this facility was extremely busy so there must be very happy customers who enjoy food and drinks there. This is definitely a 4* property and 4* prices anyone wanting 5* this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous for the value....”
Reviews.Author: frank s
Reviews.Content: if you're looking for a full service hotel in downtown montreal, this is it!...great staff....beautiful rooms....great value...we booked a package that included valet parking, continental breakfast, subway AND museum passes....that was at least three hundred dollars for the two of us for three days...you will love it!~

Reviews.Title: “Laura was great!”
Reviews.Author: Greenerpasture
Reviews.Content: We bought a groupon for three nights at HÃ´tel St Martin. Service was great, especially Laura at front desk. The only drawbacks were that the pool wasn't on the roof (so only in the sun for part of the day) and only two elevators to service quite a large building. Other than that, the service, atmosphere, and accommodation were excellent. Beware of the attached restaurant, however. It is not part of the hotel. Although the weekend staff are excellent and accommodating, the regular staff during the week are rather surly and unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience!”
Reviews.Author: NW1130
Reviews.Content: My bf and i stayed there for 2 nights while visiting montreal. We had the verriere suite and loved it! In particular the spacious washroom with a deep tub and spacious shower. The pool is not the avg hotel pool... It was small but very unique and beautiful.... We were lucky enough to get the pool to ourselves one evening. The hotel service was superb... Even had a lady pushing around a trolley full of complimentary water and snacks for us to choose at our door! Best part of this hotel is location location location! With the metro stn just across the street and also walking distance to the popular shopping streets, it was very convenient getting here and there

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel as a vacation stay in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Christine S
Reviews.Content: We parked our car and did not use it again till we left for Quebec City. The plush room was clean and kept clean during our stay. Our huge bathroom was well supplied with extra towels. The served breakfast was more than we needed. Mt Royal Park, The Museum of Fine Arts, and Old Montreal were within walking distance. The metro was also convenient. There were so many highly rated restaurants nearby that it was difficult to choose a restaurant. The hotel staff had no difficulty assisting the non-French speaking tourists from the US.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel with tiny pool”
Reviews.Author: mcdblake
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very modern, very new, has a trendy restaurant attached, and is an easy distance from old montreal and shopping. Getting around town with the bike-share program is extremely easy and cheap. The hotel "pool" is more like a very large hot tub... there isn't space for any real swimming. The staff was very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms Great location”
Reviews.Author: snowboardingfool
Reviews.Content: Nice modern rooms. Free internet. The check in was easy, Staff was friendly and knowledgeable. The beds were very comfortable and the location was close to all the places we wanted to check out. Only thing that was not great was the window into the shower. The shower has a Large wooden shade on it but it just seemed sorta of weird for 2 guys sharing a room. Overall I would recommend this room for any couple or single person traveling to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel close to Just for Laughs Festival”
Reviews.Author: mellieann
Reviews.Content: Full disclosure - we bought a Teambuy deal for $339 which entitled us to 2 nights in a Grand Luxe room with Valet parking included and continental breakfast for 2 people for both mornings. The room was on the 4th floor which we were afraid of potential noise issues but the street noise was not too bad at all. In fact the a/c drone drowned out any audible street noise but it wasn't a problem, kind of like white noise. The breakfast was good - coffee or tea, OJ, 2 small pastries, small glass of fruit cocktail, scrambled eggs, toasted baguette, piece of cheese and a small pot of ground pork pate. Time to pick up car was about 5 mins or less, we always called down from the room and by the time we got downstairs the car was waiting. The pool area is nice but its very small. No problems for us as there was hardly anyone else using the pool area when we were there so we were lucky, The only weird thing that happened to us was after housekeeping had left, we noticed that she had not replaced any of bath products (no big deal) but she had removed the soap from the room, so we were soapless the second night!! We thought the concept of needing to tap the room key before entering the floor number in the elevator was tedious but maybe the hotel has good reason for it.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure I'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: sarezar
Reviews.Content: We just visited Montreal for the first time as a family so I researched hotels before I went. I probably should've taken some of the bad reviews a bit more seriously. Good points â€¢ Great location (right in the university section of downtown and close to the metro) â€¢ New hotel (the rooms were beautiful) and most of the public spaces were pleasing) â€¢ Wonderful breakfast (I got the package that included parking and breakfast...food was delicious) â€¢ Parking (our vehicle was safely parked in an indoor garage...I had heard about vehicles being stolen, so this was important to me) Bad points â€¢ Magnetic Room keys (you need them to go anywhere and they don't always work properly...also read this on another review...it's true â€¢ Pool (not sure they could even call it that beautiful but looks more like an oversized luke warm hot tub...the photos of the pool show the ENTIRE pool â€¢ Towels for the pool had to be picked up at the front desk and returned after to the front desk (couldn't leave them in the hotel room...more up and down with the magnetic card...) â€¢ Check in (we got to our room after a 7 hr car ride to find a room that was NEVER cleaned. Then they wanted us to leave all of our stuff there while they cleaned it...or for us to leave it right in the middle of the lobby while we took off to get lunch...and didn't even offer to bring it to our room. Finally I insisted that they at least put it in storage â€¢ Service (Sub par everywhere...the lobby was polite, but not at all helpful, the bell hop complained in public about our inconvenience...the breakfast was absolutely delicious, but the service was slow and we had a new waitress one of the two days that was new with no training or common sense...actually felt bad for her, and the person who cleaned our room was negative...when we came back to our room around 5-6pm to shower and change...she still hadn't cleaned it...then she asked us to leave for an hour...) Overall takeaway â€” not the type of hotel that it aspires to be...need either more training for service, better management or more people...seemed like they were running on a shoestring service-wise

Reviews.Title: “One word...A-W-E-S-O-M-E”
Reviews.Author: FARB
Reviews.Content: What a find. Located in a very cool part of town, this new hotel is beautifully appointed and staffed by wonderful people. To give an idea of how much I liked the place, I have chosen to write the review while I am still here. Sitting in the room makes me feel like I am in a very chic Manhattan apartment. The decor is white on black, but not in the tacky plastic sort of way, but in the warm finished way. The bathroom is separated from the main part of the room by black-louvered sliding doors, on either side of which are square classic looking colonnades. The rooms have with keurig coffee machines and large flat screen TV's. Best of all, the beds are very comfortable, the linins are great and the pillows are wonderful. Do yourself a favor, stay here when in Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: MarieJosephine
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this great hotel. The hotel is new and everything in it is sparkling clean. The pool is small but provides delightful place to sit, relax and listen to the falling water. The hotel is situated in a business district but just short taxi drive, or a 20 min walk to the Old Montreal. The continental breakfast was a feast to our eyes and senses. The free valet parking was an added bonus. There was a number of good restaurants in the area as well as the Underground City which provided plenty of places to shop.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings. May or may not go back”
Reviews.Author: iamtoad2001
Reviews.Content: I had to make a last min booking and based on the reviews I decided to book this hotel. The location of the hotel was great. It is between two metro stop and two bixie bike stations. It is close to shopping and restaurants. The bars and clubs are just a few blocks away. I basically found everything within walking distance. When you check in you are given your room card and you have to scan it in the elevator before you can select the floor you wish to go to. You are only allowed to go to your room floor, the gym floor and the pool floor. The rooms are a nice size and the bathroom I had had a nice large shower with no bathtub. I believe you can get rooms with a bath tub and a fireplace. I found the swimming pool to be a bit small and was told all outside swimming pools in downtown Montreal are small. It is a lap pool that can allow two people to swim side by side. You can sun bath till about 13:30 after which the sun goes behind the hotel. Even though it was a small area I did spend about 5 hrs over two days by the pool. My biggest disappointment was the internet. I checked in on Friday and asked the desk clerk about the internet since I needed access to it to work. I was told that they had some issues in the morning but that it had been repaired. Saturday morning at 6:30am I had to log into work and could not. The internet was down. I had to walk 5 blocks to find a Starbucks so that I could work. I mentioned this to the hotel staff but no one seemed to care. I have since talked to other residents and they all said that the internet was unstable at the hotel. On a side note was caught using the stairs and was told I had to use the elevators. There are only two elevators that are used by everyone (staff and customers). So they are a bit slow.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel, can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: HarryHornet09
Reviews.Content: Finding such a great hotel in Montreal was our lucky break, but we used Tripadvisor and it worked. The hotel is only about a year old, but excellent and very clean and modern. Excellent decor and a very unusual louve screen on one wall of the bedroom in front of a glass screen behind the shower! If you want to watch your beautiful partner having a shower you can, if not, tilt down the louves, great idea. Nice dipping pool. Only thing to be careful is "recomendatios" from reception on where to eat, as the give high priced restaurants not always the best (see my recommendations on Tripadvisor). Montreal s not a cheap city and $12 for a glass on wine and $9 for a beer is a little steep, but will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JackH1970
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Le St. Martin Hotel and loved it. The rooms are modern and exceptionally clean. the package included breakfast, which was well worth it. the staff was friendly and attentive. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for the Grand Prix! We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: AFish1
Reviews.Content: Large room, excellent staff, good food (although restaurant was a bit noisy), and the location was A++ for getting to the Canadian Grand Prix on the Bixi bikes! We also liked being so close to the street parties. We would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Montreal for pleasure anytime of year. Location, location, location... Anne and Jim - Jackson, WY

Reviews.Title: “This is a WOW kind of $300 a night hotel”
Reviews.Author: Racinetv
Reviews.Content: I am not a cheap kinda anything. This was one of the best $300 a night hotels I have ever stayed in. The entire staff from beginning to end was first class. Breakfast that was INCLUDED was outstanding and this restaurant rivals some of the best in Washington, DC Great Job guys.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diiva
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and new... you can still smell the paint from the walls. The rooms are GORGEOUS!!!!!!! very tastefully done... the bed is large, no view though even though they claim that most of their rooms (De Luxe and Verriere Suites especially) have nice city views. The location is good, within walking distance to everything. We did not have any problems with the noise and our room was on the 9th floor. The pool is VERY SMALL, it's more off a jacuzzi with cold water and there is no possibility for suntanning. The reception staff is not friendly, but that's Montreal for you. The concierge staff was nice! Also the reservations manager was EXTREMELY RUDE and not accomodating on the phone and that really turned me off from going to the hotel initially. The breakfast was really good. The hotel is nice but overpriced, try to find a deal on it and then make it worth while. As an aside, upon checking out I got a nice $$$$$ charge for the minibar, which was never used!!!!!!! I didn't even know where it was in the room!!!!!! So make sure you check your minibar as soon as you go in the room to avoid the pain upon checkout... if anything is missing make sure to report it ASAP!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: cuse101
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for the U2 concert! The hotel was awesome. Location was great, staff were friendly. The pool was very unique. We went with 3 other couples and hung around the pool for 2 hours. The only complaint we had was that we had friends who stayed at the hotel and their room was not ready until 5 pm. Other than that it was a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it the first time, not so impressed the second.”
Reviews.Author: MickRLondon
Reviews.Content: We booked into this hotel as a last minute thing two Saturday nights ago after travelling up from Toronto. It was glorious, the room (1409) was stunning with a huge bed that was so very comfy, large tv, mini bar and everything you could possibly need. The view of skyscrapers reflected in the building opposite was captivating. The bathroom was large and had both a two man bath tub and and a two man walk in shower, the bathroom itself opened up into the room which is a lovely idea. We both slept soundly as it was so quiet and comfortable. Room service was very prompt and all of the staff we encountered were friendly and very helpful. Sadly when we arrived back the next Saturday night (after spending a week in Quebec City) it was quite a different story. We had an early flight to Boston on the Sunday morning so decided that we'd stay here again and have a nice relax. We were given room 804, again the room itself was gorgeous and the bed and bathroom were exquisite but the noise was incredible. On the 14th floor we had been too high to hear anything but the eighth was awful!! The glazing on the windows was so thin that you may as well have been trying to sleep in the middle of the street. The main feature of the room was the window and the view but quite frankly the view was better on the 14th. The blinds on the window failed to shut out the light and the curtain only covered about a quarter of the backs of the blinds. I suppose it's called art but the room was totally light from dawn onwards so even if you had managed to nod off through the noise for a few hours you wouldn't have managed it for long. If you do choose to stay here refuse any room below the 12th Floor if you want any peace. Oh and I'd also make sure they haven't put any "hen do" parties on your floor too as they were also an isssue.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful newer hotel”
Reviews.Author: happyroadtravler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very convient to the downtown shopping area and some very good restaurants. Staff was friendly, rooms neat and clean and breakfast was included!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: nan61743
Reviews.Content: We had a really great time. Everyone was so nice and the hotel is very elegant. While waiting for the car, someone from the hotel ask us if we would like a cup of coffee for our trip. So thoughtful and unexpected. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful brand new Montreal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarahbear99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Le Saint Martin in Montreal for the second time last week. This will now be my hotel of choice when traveling in Montreal. Beautiful hotel, brand new, very clean, perfectly located, just a wonderful spot. I highly recommend this hotel for business or leisure travel any time.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Sumo7
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at Le St-Martin Hotel this weekend in a Suite VerriÃ¨re on the 5th floor. It was very noisy. We could hear people screaming during the night and the traffic was loud. The bed was very confortable. The staff was nice and the room was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Darn glad I found this gem!”
Reviews.Author: Kuchinga
Reviews.Content: Beautifully appointed rooms with a very modern design. Convenient location. Very attentive staff who were eager to please. Thoughtful conveniences like water, nuts and fruit provided gratis.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here”
Reviews.Author: jebcoent
Reviews.Content: Never actually stayed here. Was trying to get room here for U2 concert in on July 8 - 10. Looks like a great hotel but I tried to book using a travelzoo voucher and nothing was available. We already had reservation at regular rate so asked them to cancel it and rebook with the vouchers and they refused. Not only that they refused to cancel the existing fully flexible reservation since I had booked them online. Went back to look at the confirmation and the number to contact was the same one I just called. I called back and it was cancelled no problem but somehow there was still no availability. I was told because it was overbooked for that evening. I would have accepted all this had the representative not been so rude about the whole matter.

Reviews.Title: “When the 5-Star hotels aren't available...”
Reviews.Author: DanielC44
Reviews.Content: Only a year old at this writing, Le St-Martin still seems brand new. The rooms are modern and elegant with spacious bathrooms.The downside is the lack of real amenities. They have a fitness center, but there are only 4 machines (eliptical, treadmill, cycle & universal gym). The have a pool, but it's a lap pool. They have a restaurant & lounge, but it's a very trendy place which gets crowded & noisy, and guests are not guaranteed a table unless they reserve well in advance. Other than one bad night in the restaurant (it took nearly 30 minutes to place our order after we were given water, and were given the wrong food, and were otherwise ignored for lengths of time), it was a pleasant stay. It's situated between 2 Metro stops, and 1 block from St. Catherine, so nothing is very far away. Overall, the staff was helpful and friendly. We'd consider going again if other choices weren't available (ones with greater choices in amenities).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in the heart of Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: KandF-MS
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect and the staff is very helpful. We were greeted warmly and provided suggestions of restaurants that were just wonderful.
