The hotel isn't a steal financially, but for the location, it seems just about right. The rooms were comfortable and the extras great, but I wouldn't bother upgrading to one of the luxury rooms. Our only complaint has to do with the floor to ceiling windows in the luxury room. The windows are wonderful during the day, but the lights on the side of the hotel light the place up at night. A curtain that would be able to go around the entire room would easily solve that problem.

Reviews.Title: “Montreal`s finest”
Reviews.Author: nickt84
Reviews.Content: In terms of the quality of accomodations, this hotel is hard to beat. This is a gorgeous (and brand-new) hotel in the heart of downtown Montreal. Great for young professionals. Stylish and luxurious, will be staying there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME PLACE !! HIGHLY RECOMMEND”
Reviews.Author: ajpslp
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and all I can say is WOW!! Place was equivalent to a 4 star hotel in the states.. Rooms are PERFECT!! Air worked better then great.. Have drinks and snacks by front desk.Pool is tiny, so if u looking to hang out by pool its no bigger then 7 feet wide by 30 feet long . Short walk (3/4 mile) to main street with shopping literally around the corner.. Although it wasn't a bachelor type hotel we made the best of it.. Front desk was very polite , bell hops were helpful... Highly recommend !!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and comfortable - Didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: kristin_in_boston
Reviews.Content: We just returned from three nights at Le St-Martin Hotel and really enjoyed our stay. We had one of the regular rooms and it was very nice - spacious, good view, comfortable bed, and incredible bathroom. Our air-conditioner worked well so they seem to have fixed any previous problems with this (and someone even came by at one point to make sure that it was working). The service was outstanding, from the front desk to the valet. Location is great - only a few minutes walk from many stores, restaurants, and bars, and also close to a subway station. After hours of walking/hiking each day we looked forward to coming back to our room. Will definitely stay here again! Minor complaints: The pool is pretty but tiny, and the plants around it look a bit sad and could be spruced up. Wireless internet is available but the connection is really slow.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal romantic indulgence & location for 25th anniversary celebration”
Reviews.Author: JJBirch
Reviews.Content: Warm welcome upon early arrival, our Suite Verriere ready and special request for higher floor had been met. Very friendly, competent reception and valet service. The room was gorgeous with floor to ceiling windows, comfy bed and pillows, stunning bathroom, free WiFi, luxurious amenities. Enjoyed the unique, jetted, minimalist pool w. its arched bridge and clever design. Location in Crescent Street neighborhood enabled endless dining and shopping possibilities plus a night of great music in a jazz club. Montreal is a bicyclist's dream; we especially enjoyed the trails along the canal and Lachine Rapides. Minor complaints: using TV was a challenge w/o a channel guide, plus a concierge map of the city's bike trails would be a plus. Location, location, location, great staff, and room views will bring us back.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: denalda
Reviews.Content: this is a nice reasonable hotel with a good staff and it is very new and very clean. it isn't the 4 seasons. the gym has a treadmill which was broken, one elliptical trainer and a bike. when I was there, a young woman was on the elliptical for a hour, so that pretty much killed my idea of a morning work out. The pool is more like a hot tub, and very small but very nice. You couldn't do laps in it. The staff is very helpful and very caring. There is no concierge. But we were recommended to the Scandavia Spa in Old Montreal and it was great and they made the booking for us, and gave them my credit card number. Everyone is very welcoming that works there. When there was confusion about our suites cleaning, someone arrived at 4:45 to get it done. The sheets are great and the beds are really comfortable. It is close to St Catherines but, I didn't think there were many good restaurants in the neighbourhood, they were mostly tourist traps.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally well appointed rooms: luxurious decor, immaculate, quiet, great location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: Phantasman
Reviews.Content: On the former site of the famous Ben's delicatessen on the corner of de Maisonneuve & Mansfield, across the street from the Metro (subway), this is one sweet hotel. Beautifully appointed luxury: huge TV, free coffee, quiet & clean. Very reasonable rates too. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “COULD NOT BE BETTER”
Reviews.Author: faldetta
Reviews.Content: I could not have had a more delightful time at this hotel. No matter how many times we called the front desk with questions they were always more than happy to help. The room was beautiful and was very clean when we arrived. Not only did they let us check in 4 hours early because our bus got in early but they also extended our checkout 2 hours for free with no problem. It was 40 degree when I went and the outdoor pool is still the perfect temperature. Everything about this hotel was just perfect. The location was also amazing, one street away from St Catherines which has amazing shopping, which the metro and bus extremely close by.

Reviews.Title: “Virtually Flawless”
Reviews.Author: vanessm
Reviews.Content: I'm just finishing up a 4 day stay at Le St-Martin. I booked a Verriere suit, which features floor to ceiling widows and loved every minute! I booked through expedia, as it was cheaper than through the hotel's site. As a few others mentioned, this room is not super spacious, but has many amenities that make up for it in my opinion. The king bed was super comfortable. I totally agree with other reviewers that it made it difficult to get up in the morning. The room features a cute fireplace as well. The bathroom is speacious, well lit and includes everything you could need and then some! The bathroom has a double sink, soaker tub, glass shower, in addition to a small flatscreen tv and phone. This room also has a desk, with a fun touch lamp, ipod dock, closet and dressing mirror. The staff I interacted with were also very professional and friendly. I speak a bit of French but am not advanced so I often ended up speak to the staff in English, which was not a problem. This hotel is located right downtown, so you would not come across many people who do not know English. It's conveniently located close to two metro stations, one is right across the street. Several shops and restaurants are also walking distance. My one criticism is the selection of room service. They offer breakfast and lunch/dinner options. However, the breakfast selection I felt was a little limited in that there are only about 7 or 8 choices all at the price of $17.95 plus tax and gratuity. Beverages are not included in the price, however there is a Krups coffee maker in the room. They offer you a caffeinated and decaffeinated option daily. If you'd like an additional cup, you must pay $1.50 or call room service for a $4.50 hot beverage, including tea! It would be great if they added more simple choices, such as a bagel or yogurt. There is an Eggspectation down the street I would recommend for breakfast instead. This is my main criticism. All in all, excellent hotel. Still under one year old and feels new. Great ambiance. Walking distance to so many things. I don't think you can go wrong if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend getaway in the city”
Reviews.Author: Love_to_Travel1624
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Le St. Martin downtown location. The location was extremely convenient; close to most of the downtown shopping, dining, and clubbing hotspots. It also happens to be right across the street from a main Montreal subway/metro station. The staff was really friendly; with great customer service. Love the valet parking option. We stayed in one of the suites which was equipped with everything to ensure their guests feel pampered (i.e. Keurig machine, IPod docking station, soaker bathub with flat-panel TV, bathrobes, and even slippers). The room decor was also very chic and calming...I felt like I was in a spa. And, the beds and pillows were heavenly; best night's sleep in a long time :-) We also tried the continental breakfast in the restaurant downstairs. It was excellent! I would definitely recommend this hotel...whether your traveling from out of town or just want a short, weekend getaway in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic...”
Reviews.Author: DMMel123
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a great restaurant and bar. Clean, modern, quiet and great rates. Loved it so much I've just siged it as our corprate hotel for Montreal. Makes business travel more enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Overheated room”
Reviews.Author: 2denise
Reviews.Content: We had no control over the room thermostat and two visits by hotel maintenance failed to fix it. When I brought this to the attention of the front desk at checkout, there was no apology. I've sent an email to the hotel about the situation but have received no response in a week. Also, the so-called fitness centre is minuscule with no floor space for stretching or exercises.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, room”
Reviews.Author: MDH1109
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the Verriere Suites for a Friday/ Saturday trip to Montreal. In the past we've stayed in several of the major hotels in this vicinity. This was our best experience so far. We had great service and the room had everything you could want. While we've stayed in roomier suites, this one was unique in that it had expansive views down two separate streets. Although only one block away from all the shopping and nightlife, the street the hotel is on is fairly quiet. We would recommend this hotel to anyone. We will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: redberrie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really well kept. Our suite was beautiful and the maid service did its best to keep it clean. They went out of their way a few times to get us drinks when we requested them (even though they dont have all hours room service from what we could tell) and also went out of their way to order me flowers (from my boyfriend) for Valentine's Day. The only downside of this hotel was that the bedding wasn't that comfortable. The sheets aren't that soft and the pillows were a bit hard but everything else was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in montreal”
Reviews.Author: saharsh
Reviews.Content: I had a second thought about this hotel because there is not a lot of reviews about it, but it was the best hotel in montreal. Clean and beautiful rooms with a great view. The service was great and the staff were very nice and helpful. It's close to everything in downtown toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patches004
Reviews.Content: Just back from a wonderful stay at the Le St-Martin Hotel. It has a nouveau chic style that has just the right amount of luxury and comfort. The rooms are spacious and the beds are just heavenly!!! The staff were very friendly and helpful and just loved the location! Would definitely go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelSullivan63
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Le St-Martin Hotel in Montreal and was totally impressed. From the Valet Parking Guy that met us as we pulled up to the Front Desk that checked us out they were all very professional. The room was exceptionally clean and the bed was great. As a regular traveler i would rate this as an exceptional value. As we got into our car to leave one of our friends remarked "what a great hotel". We all agreed. Kudos to the owners for putting together such a fine staff. Michael Sullivan, Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room but stiinky bath”
Reviews.Author: Nana1601
Reviews.Content: Not often do you pay for a lovely room and have the bathroom smell like a sewer. A drain in the floor of the bathroom emitted a horrible odor. A trash can was placed over the drain, but did little to contain the smell. The internet was not available for almost the entire weekend of our stay. As for positives, the location was great and the staff courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, classy and chic - a hotel like no other”
Reviews.Author: kcwoo
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of Montreal, Le St-Martin conveys a sense of luxury and elegance. The staff is friendly, courteous, and helpful in any way they possibly can be. The room is unparallel - the furnishing and embellishments are trendy and exclusively found at this particular hotel. Just a corner away from a metro station (Peel) and a brisk walk away from the shopping district, the hotel is conveniently located in the centre of all the action. This is a hotel like no other and one that you should experience firsthand.

Reviews.Title: “Haven of peace”
Reviews.Author: Francois-xavier09
Reviews.Content: Haven of peace for lovers, the St. Martin offers a wonderful experience. The charms of the chambers are amazing and the comforts are laudable. Also, the staff is cordial and cares about customers. My preferred thing of my visit is the architecture of the Hotel, elegant and modern. So, I recommend the St. Martin to everybody. Best room ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mollybarclay
Reviews.Content: The service was outstanding. The hotel was located in the heart of the city. EVrything was only steps away

Reviews.Title: “Pampered in Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: Symposia
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Le St. Martin hotel in downtown Montreal and experienced what a luxury hotel should be like. The staff were very professional and courteous. The room was a picture perfect post card of sophisticated comfort and design. Not too mention the most confortable night's sleep I have experienced in a long time in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the best !”
Reviews.Author: max29ro
Reviews.Content: really i can find anything to complain i feelt like a king !!! the staff is extremely nice and profesional the rooms are big super clean and feels very reach ....and the management are great.

Reviews.Title: “Business Traveler's Nightmare: Do not Stay”
Reviews.Author: chictravelista
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively for business and pleasure. Despite mixed reviews on Trip Advisor, I succumbed to allure of staying at a brand new boutique hotel Montreal. However, I was really disappointed by the Hotelâ€™s utter disregard for their hotel guests. I had several challenges (just thinking about this hotel makes me angry), but here are the major issues: NO Room Service I understand that it takes a while for any new hotel to run at full potential. However, I do not accept the complete disregard of customer service. I asked the Hotel restaurant if they were able to deliver my food order to my room (offered to pay extra), and if that was not possible, could they call me to pick up my order when ready. NO. If these options are not possible, the hotel should offer guests a free drink or appetizer while they wait to say â€˜sorry weâ€™re still going through some growing pains, but we appreciate your business, have a drink on us.â€™ NO Internet The â€˜complimentaryâ€™ internet was so slow, consider it non-existent. Hotel management confirmed internet is an issue, and I must bear with it. So I asked where I could print my boarding pass, the answer was â€“ sorry we donâ€™t have a printer but you can print it at the airport. Well uh you have a printer behind the front desk, how about a little help since you lack a business centre and working internet? Taxi Stand Politcs Upon check out, I asked for a cab to the airport. The hotel porter took my luggage outside and strongly requested I wait inside. 20 min pass â€“ no cab - Iâ€™m now running late for my flight. I step outside and see a taxi stand right across the hotel! Upset, I grab my luggage and flag my own taxi. Hereâ€™s the scoop: The hotel wonâ€™t flag local cabs unless the cab driver agrees pays a fee; and since the fee is so high, most cab drivers canâ€™t afford it. Therefore the hotel has a relationship with a cab company that dispatches upon call. Thanks to Le St-Martin politics, I nearly missed my flight! Weed smokers Since the internet wasnâ€™t working, I thought Iâ€™d take the opportunity to lounge by the pool deck and catch up on some reading. Not happening. A bunch of guys were smoking weed out in the open . The stench was so bad had to immediated go inside. What type of secuiryt/property management is this? Really small pool I really loved the pictures of the outdoor pool on the website- looked very big and impressive. In reality it was the smallest hotel pool I've ever seen. So over $200 later, what did I get? a frustrating experience in a new hotel that obviously doesnâ€™t care about their guests. Will I stay here again? absolutely not. There are tons of other great hotels at the same price point in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice design, service could use some upgrade”
Reviews.Author: bizwarrior
Reviews.Content: Design is nice, rooms are lovely. service was really lacking. Both at the valet and the front desk. We didn't use too many services and the people working at the desk lacked local knowledge. We did receive a restaurant recommendation for Bonaparte in the old port. The bar seems active and there were lots of people enjoying themselves. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place... but it needs to improve!”
Reviews.Author: ebjp
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a weekend at le Saint-Martin. Had a "verriÃ¨ve" room that was luxurious and comfortable (though the bathroom lacks hooks to hang the bathrobes). However, we had a number of annoying experiences during our stay: - At check-in, they had cancelled our reservation and could not explain why except by saying that it was a mistake. Luckily, they were capable of back tracking and give us a room. - They greatly insisted that we take their parking service, as if there was no other choice. - The complimentary breakfast was ok. On the first morning, the service went well. On the second, it was absolut chaos with the maitre d speaking so loud you had the impression that we were at the New York stock exchange. It took about 40 minutes to be served with the croissants and the juice coming after the eggs. - The magnetic cards to access the elevators, the room, pool and fitness center were difficult to use which became very annoying. - We had to go to the front desk to get a towel for the pool. A 25$ deposit was required... and we were told to bring back the towel at the desk and could not leave it at the room. - At check out, they wanted to bill an additional $80 for a movie that we had not ordered (they recognized their mistake) and for $30 a night parking. At check in, we were told that the parking was $10 a night. The person at the desk said she could only make me a $14 a night rate... - Overall, the quality of the service is simply not up to par with a place that aspires to be a high end venue. Therefore, we would not recommed this place until it improves. For those who want a first rate hotel, there are other choices in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Do not recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Rojo_Max
Reviews.Content: Good location BUT rooms are small, internet connection is horrible (terribly slow and not steady), 3/4 of TV channels don't work, bed is not comfortable, room set up does not make sense (coffee machine and cups/glasses in bathroom; unless multi-tasking was in mind, it makes no sense), water pressure in bathroom is weak and cold water is warm, very noisy lobby during lunch and diner time as it is opened to 1st floor restaurant. No business center! Only 1 computer with horrible internet speed and no privacy (opened to the entrance of restaurant and seating area). This hotel was built new and opened in June of 2010; it should be perfect in every sense but to the contrary. Only positive point is people working there: helpful and courteous. I do not recommend this hotel. Expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Really Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Scoobie11155019
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. I have stayed at a lot of Montreal Hotels over the years and given its location and quality of service, I was suitably impressed with the hotel. There were a few hiccups - breakfast took a bit too long to serve - but overall it was a lovely place that was clearly trying hard to be the hotel it can be, a beautiful downtown hotel in a classic Montreal style.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lawgirlMI
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the Marseille room, which the site boasts to be 800 sqft. I highly doubt the room was that big, and I think the pics on the site make the rooms out to be nicer than expected. We paid a reduced rate with one night free, but I think this is all the room would be worth. I would not pay full price to stay there. Saying that though, I really liked the hotel for the price we paid. Our room was on the top floor in a corner and it was SILENT. We never heard a neighbor, never heard a maid cleaning, NOTHING. Our room was also very comfy, and we had one of the most comfy beds I have ever slept in at a hotel. I slept well all 5 nights we were there. The living room area was nice too for lounging, although I could not figure out the fireplace. The bathroom was super nice. There was a shower and a tub that was separate and gorgeous. We had two sinks (one of which was broke the first night we were there but fixed by the next day). We had three phones, wireless internet (which was actually kinda a slow connection, but worked for the most part). One thing that annoyed me is the maids kept cleaning and entering the room even with our do not disturb sign up. Three days they did this. One day, they tried to get in while we were naked and getting ready, which was super annoying. The front desk and concierge were super nice. Service was great (except the maid thing). The pool area was small, but very kewl on the rooftop. There was also nice outside seating area for drinks. Overall, we really liked this hotel an it's location RIGHT next to the Peel metro.

Reviews.Title: “Service was terrible...and they just don't care”
Reviews.Author: darthwolf
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a lot smaller then pictured. No business area as indicated on the website, it's only one computer (very slow internet). 1st room had no internet (lan or wireless). Had to switch rooms which only had wireless, lan connection was not working. Wireless maxed at 11kps. I mean I've then the train, bus and even the malls where free wireless was faster. Pool is noting but a lane, maybe 15 ft in length and 4 feet across? Basically you would not be able to swim, but nice to just lounge i guess. The work out room that over looks the pool (well u could see the edge of the pool if you press your face against the glass) was small and not very useful. Both the pool and fitness room over looks a ugly parking lot. I stayed 5 nights and 2 days received no housekeeping. My card de-magnetized 3 times I was there. Kept it in my pocket out of touch from credit cards and cell phones. I know it's a new hotel but with all this, there was no apolgies what so ever and no attempt to make things right. This is a very bad start to what could have been a good business hotel, but I will NOT return and will be taking my business elsewhere. Oh, and they only had 2 elevator which were extremely slow. Asked several time about a late checkout and each time was told I had to ask on the day I left. Normally it's 11am but was only able to get a 12pm checkout. Funny thing was the hotel was not fully booked. Had to keep my luggage @ reception. When I return to pick it up @ 5pm i check my old room. Of course housekeeping didn't even come as I left the "please make up room" sign stuck inbetween the door and it was still where I left it. The rooms were nice (since it just opened Jun 2010). You could nNOT connect your laptop to the TV as they disabled the controls for input. Fireplace was fake and did not generate any heat. Not a concern now but in the winter if you were expecting a gas fireplace you would be disappointed. Not sure if it's in the works but this hotel does not offer room service.
